intro: Rubus × sedinensis, commonly known as the sedentary blackberry, is a hybrid plant resulting from the cross between Rubus ursinus and Rubus glaucus. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas. Due to its hybrid nature, it exhibits a range of morphological variations.
